title: Amid the Gaza War, Israel Is More Divided and Isolated Than Ever
summary: The longest war of an endless Israeli-Palestinian conflict has come to challenge Israel’s own image and understanding of itself.

title: Strong-Armed by Trump, Netanyahu Embraces Gaza Deal as a Personal Win
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel took credit for an emerging agreement, but it was clear that President Trump was calling the shots.

title: Rubio Says U.S. Wants Quick Deal to Bring Gaza Hostages Home
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said talks on a U.S. plan to end the Gaza war are focused now on a hostage release in exchange for an Israeli withdrawal from parts of Gaza. Difficult issues will be left for later, he said.

title: Both Parties Are Resigned to Deadlock as Government Shutdown Takes Hold
summary: Republicans, who hold a governing trifecta, have adopted a mostly passive stance while Democrats dig in for a fight, with both feeling they have the political upper hand.

title: Not All National Parks Remain Open in the Shutdown. Here’s What to Know.
summary: Some underground attractions are closed, and many outdoor sites have reduced their services.

title: Push for Military Coverage of I.V.F. Faces Challenge in Congress
summary: A proposal to expand the Defense Department’s health care plan to include in vitro fertilization is moving through Congress but could die behind closed doors, again.

title: Can Conversion Therapy Be Banned? Supreme Court Will Decide on Colorado Law.
summary: Colorado and more than 20 other states restrict therapists from trying to change the gender identity or sexual orientation of clients under age 18.

title: A Pacific Gateway Shows the Kremlin’s Grip on Russia’s Vast Expanse
summary: In a country where power is highly centralized, Moscow sets the tone for Vladivostok, 4,000 miles away, complicating longstanding ambitions to make it a trading powerhouse.

title: Russia Targets Ukraine’s Energy Infrastructure With Deadly Bombardment
summary: At least five people were killed before dawn in another large-scale and wide-ranging assault.

title: Craft Breweries Struggle as Sales and Appetites Wane
summary: Once the darling of the alcohol industry, small-batch beer makers are shutting down because of increased competition and flagging interest.

title: This Crazy Crypto Heist Is the Story of Our Time
summary: The souring of the relationship between Georgia’s billionaire master and his former aide is a cautionary tale.

title: The West Is Defined by Loss
summary: Loss has become a pervasive condition of life in Europe and America.

title: Donald Trump, the Sports Fan
summary: Today, we take a look at the president’s sports fandom and what it reveals about his worldview.

title: Canada Post Strike Poses Challenges for Remote Communities
summary: A strike, and growing prospects of drastic cuts to the state-owned postal service, make life very hard for Canada’s remote communities.

title: Leader of U.K. Conservatives Vows to Deport 150,000 People a Year
summary: Kemi Badenoch, whose party is sinking in polls, outlined plans resembling Trump policies against those accused of being in the United States illegally.

title: New York City Is Full of Green Space. You Just Have to Find It.
summary: The city’s millions of residents are crammed together, competing for space to live, play, work and rest.
